name: Pullman Resort Bunker Bay

reviews.text: We didn't know what to expect having never visited this part of Australia before and had been recommended this resort by an Aussie. We were not disappointed. The rooms were well appointed and the beach was great, with very few people on it. It was an easy drive to go down to the Margaret River wineries and we visited several of them. The pool at the hotel was great but it was all spoilt by the flies - we aren't sure if this is a seasonal thing - but they were a real pest. It's impossible to sit outside to eat without being bothered by them here. The food in the restaurant was excellent, as was the breakfast buffet. All the staff are friendly and helpful too. A really great three days.
reviews.title: Fantastic introduction to South West Australia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, beautiful scenery. Spacious rooms, great kitchenette and tvs etc. Food at the resort was great. Beaches of the best in the world.
reviews.title: Incredible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 6th time back and its as good as the first time! If you feel you just what to get away for the weekend or just a few days this is it. So relaxing, tranquil and peaceful, ifs it stay in your room and veg out, or taking a peaceful romantic walk along the beach and you might be lucky and spot a whale! The staff are so helpful professional and attentive, the buffet breakfast is really nice, lunch and dinner great. The restaurant is especially beautiful for its views early morning till that beautiful sunset. So romantic! The rooms are just lovely, the beds so comfy. We just love and will always stay here for that Time Out!
reviews.title: Time out!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great resort almost right at the tip of Cape Naturaliste, in the most north-western part of the Margaret River area in WA. Just a short stroll from any villa to the beautiful beach, which was never crowded not even during the most bussiest holiday season in Australia. So much to see and do, even within just a 20-30 km radius like visiting the near Lighthouse, Walking, Dining, visiting local Micro Breweries as well as Wineries and Olive farms. Just make sure you have a car if you want to drive around a bit, though there are wine tour operators near by and you can organise pick-up from the resort.
reviews.title: Great Place to relax

reviews.text: The resort has an excellent restaurant with a great name 'Other Side of the Moon'. Food is very good and they have excellent staff, many on tourist/working visas from well hospitality educated Europe. This gives this place a bit of 'global' flair.
reviews.title: A very merry xmas

reviews.text: My friend suggested this place as she had been before and loved it. We had a group of about 10 and stayed here for 2 nights in October - its spectacular for the price we paid. Just as a basis for comparison, we had been relatively worried when we were planning to visit Perth CITY, as we could not find a decent budget hotel with rates under AUD100 a night even! Luckily, we managed to stay with a friend in Perth city.
reviews.title: Worth the stay and well-priced.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, we took a 2 hour road trip to Margaret River and stayed here and LOVED IT! For AUD85 per person for 2 nights, we got a high-ceilinged 'villa' with 2 bedrooms, living room, kitchenette, washer and dryer. Margaret River itself is spectacular but this hotel is situated at a bay (obviously), the restaurant and lobby thus offer spectacular views of the ocean - I'm not sure if there were rooms with this view, but the family 'villas' we were in did not. Nonetheless, the beach is just a 5 min walk away, and its SUCH a beautiful beach. blue waters and skies, but so so so so so cold! but Australia does have cold waters! Hence, the wildlife i.e. dolphins, sharks etc etc.
reviews.title: great hotel, avoid the lakeside rooms for peace

reviews.text: The service was very adequate - they came relatively quickly when we said we needed help cleaning up a spill in the room. However, they had a very strange response to our request for "soft rolls/buns" for our dinner we cooked in. They gave us a whole loaf of tiptop (cheapish) white bread! we had a good laugh about it though :P
reviews.title: 3 nights in Bunker Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this place as a good find.
reviews.title: Nice getaway in Bunker Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, well organised and efficient with friendly staff. Great pool but the gym equipment was lacking other than a few cardio machines. The beach at the bottom of the property is beautiful. The standard of the rooms is very high and the prices in the restaurant are very reasonable. There are no other options for dinner without driving for 15 minutes. My only problem with the place was the wildlife! The frogs at the lakeside rooms were so loud I had to drag my mattress into the bathroom to get some peace and quiet! We were moved without issue to a better room. The flies are also horrendous until late January. If you book a wine tour avoid Taste of the south.
reviews.title: Relaxing cook-for-yourself, near to the beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to bunker bay resort on new years eve. The service was great, the people were great. however for what we paid for you tell me if this is 5 star luxury?
reviews.title: NOT GOOD FOR WHAT YOU PAY FOR

reviews.text: 1.our bed was two single beds pushed together.
reviews.title: gorgeous location

reviews.text: 2. pillows were flat and lumpy.
reviews.title: soggy BBQ's!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. room service was high rates, but was served in a brown paper bag???
reviews.title: Amazing location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 4. paid $300 for a new years eve dinner - and the fish fillet was a pale grey colour, the overall meal was really very unappealing.
reviews.title: great service

reviews.text: Four of us stayed in the 2 bedroom apartment and found it quite spacious for the 2 nights we were there. Both parties had private shower and toilet/bathroom area and the kitchen dining area was really good. The decor was very modern and the view whilst not exactly showing the ocean was still pretty- showing the excellent landscaping of the resort. The pool was beautiful, infinity style and the beach was glorious. The scenery to die for.
reviews.title: Beautiful beach, very nice accommodation
Relaxing
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our visit. I must say the TV in the lounge area did not appear to work, but no one appeared to notice, however I should have reported it to reception, but the day I checked out was the morning of the dreadful fires at Prevelly Beach and everyone was upset, naturally, so a non working TV paled into insignificance.
Great resort for a completely relaxing holiday. I will definitely go back to lie by the pool.
reviews.title: Simply Beautiful

reviews.text: My 21 yr old daughter and I wanted to spend a couple of nights catching up in Luxury while I was visiting from Tas. and Bunker Bay Resort seemed like the perfect place . We werent disappointed. On arrival we had booked a massage in the Day spa. It was 1 hour of pure heaven, a great start to our trip. We then went to check in but a mistake had been made on the bed arrangement in our room. With out hesitation the friendly recepionist upgraded us to a two bdrm spa villa unit which were were delighted in. WOW, an extremely well appointed villa with a pamper pack for us. We felt very special and cared for..
reviews.title: Lost it's shine!?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was beautiful and very clean. Heated to 26dg made it just right. The only annoyance was a toddler and his father who continually round around the edge of the pool. Hard to relax and read while knowing that is extremely dangerous. No one pulled them up.
reviews.title: Sweet

aka: Quay West Resort Bunker Bay Hotel
